lead_paragraph: Residents say they have been stunned to read evidence that priests they knew were secretly abusing children — findings a grand jury report called “staggering and sobering.”

headline.print_headline: Diocese Reeling Over Sex Abuse From Long Ago
headline.main: As Pennsylvania Confronts Clergy Sex Abuse, Victims and Lawmakers Act

snippet: Residents say they have been stunned to read evidence that priests they knew were secretly abusing children — findings a grand jury report called “staggering and sobering.”
abstract: More than 250 child sexual abuse survivors have come forward after Pennsylvania grand jury report revealed that Diocese of Altoona-Johnstown engaged in extensive cover-up of abuse by church officials; Atty Gen Kathleen G Kane says that her investigation is far from over, and that she is already looking into allegations in another diocese.
